description: Numbers n such that n remains prime through 2 iterations of function f(x) = 10x + 9.
comments: n, 10*n+9 and 100*n+99 are primes. [From _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 04 2010]
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: Select[Prime[Range[400]],AllTrue[NestList[10#+9&,#,2],PrimeQ]&] (* The program uses the AllTrue function from Mathematica version 10 *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jun 05 2015 *)
prog: (MAGMA) [n: n in [1..100000] | IsPrime(n) and IsPrime(10*n+9) and IsPrime(100*n+99)] [From _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 04 2010]
author: _David W. Wilson_
